= target =
function: unitptr '''target'''(s : string);

The '''target''' function returns a unit pointer to a unit with a specified symbolic name.

== Description ==
This function searches the entire game world for a unit with the specified symbolic name. The function uses the symbolic name system to locate units globally, regardless of their current location or zone.

The symbolic name system allows units to be uniquely identified across the entire game world using names in the format "name@zone" or descriptive names. This is particularly useful for finding specific NPCs, objects, or players that need to be referenced globally.

== Parameters ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Parameter !! Type !! Description
|-
| s || string || The symbolic name of the unit to find
|}

== Return Value ==
The function returns a unitptr:
* Pointer to the unit with the matching symbolic name
* Null if no matching unit is found
* Null if the symbolic name parameter is empty

== Examples ==
=== Find Specific Player ===
 dilbegin find_player_by_name(player_name : string);
 var
   target : unitptr;
 code
 {
   target := target(player_name + "@global");
   
   if (target)
   {
     sendtext("Found player: " + target.name + "<br/>", self);
   sendtext("Location: " + target.outside.title + "<br/>", self);
   }
   else
   {
     sendtext("Player '" + player_name + "' not found.<br/>", self);
   }
 }
 dilend

=== Find City Guard ===
 dilbegin find_guard();
 var
   guard : unitptr;
 code
 {
   guard := findsymbolic("guard@midgaard");
   
   if (guard)
   {
     sendtext("Found city guard: " + guard.name + "<br/>", self);
     sendtext("Location: " + guard.outside.title + "<br/>", self);
   }
   else
   {
     sendtext("City guard not found.<br/>", self);
   }
 }
 dilend

=== Bounty Hunter System ===
 dilbegin bounty_check();
 var
   criminal : unitptr;
   hunter : unitptr;
 code
 {
   criminal := activator;
   hunter := findsymbolic("bounty_hunter");
   
   if (criminal && hunter)
   {
     sendtext("Criminal: " + criminal.name + "<br/>", self);
     sendtext("Hunter: " + hunter.name + "<br/>", self);
     
     // Notify hunter of criminal
     act("$1n has been notified that $2n is wanted for bounty hunting.", A_SOMEONE, criminal, null, hunter, TO_CHAR);
   }
   else
   {
     sendtext("Either criminal or hunter not available.<br/>", self);
   }
 }
 dilend

=== Global Item Search ===
 dilbegin find_unique_item();
 var
   item : unitptr;
   sym_name : string;
 code
 {
   // Create symbolic name for unique item
   sym_name := "unique_sword_" + itoa(realtime);
   
   // Find the item
   item := findsymbolic(sym_name);
   
   if (item)
   {
     sendtext("Found unique item: " + item.name + "<br/>", self);
     sendtext("Symbolic name: " + sym_name + "<br/>", self);
   }
   else
   {
     sendtext("Unique item not found.<br/>", self);
   }
 }
 dilend

=== Zone-based Search ===
 dilbegin search_zone_items(zone_name : string);
 var
   units : stringlist;
   i : integer;
 code
 {
   // Find all units in specific zone
   units := findsymbolic("*@" + zone_name);
   
   sendtext("Units in zone '" + zone_name + "':<br/>", self);
   
   i := 0;
   while (i < length(units))
   {
     sendtext(itoa(i + 1) + ": " + symname(units.[i]) + "<br/>", self);
     i := i + 1;
   }
 }
 dilend

=== Character Tracking ===
 dilbegin track_character();
 var
   char : unitptr;
   sym_name : string;
 code
 {
   char := activator;
   
   if (char.type != UNIT_ST_PC)
   {
     sendtext("Target must be a player character.<br/>", self);
     quit;
   }
   
   // Create unique symbolic name for tracking
   sym_name := "tracked_char_" + char.name + "_" + itoa(realtime);
   
   // Store tracking reference
   addextra(char.extra, {"character_tracking"}, sym_name);
   
   sendtext("Character " + char.name + " is now being tracked.<br/>", self);
 }
 dilend

=== Multiple Target Search ===
 dilbegin find_multiple_targets();
 var
   targets : stringlist;
   i : integer;
 code
 {
   // Define symbolic names to search for
   targets := findsymbolic("wizard@global");
   targets := findsymbolic("guard@midgaard");
   targets := findsymbolic("healer@global");
   
   sendtext("Found targets:<br/>", self);
   
   i := 0;
   while (i < length(targets))
   {
     sendtext(itoa(i + 1) + ": " + symname(targets.[i]) + "<br/>", self);
     i := i + 1;
   }
 }
 dilend

=== Safe Target Validation ===
 dilbegin safe_target_search(target_name : string);
 var
   target : unitptr;
   sym_name : string;
 code
 {
   // Validate input
   if (target_name == "")
   {
     sendtext("Please specify a target name.<br/>", self);
     quit;
   }
   
   // Create safe symbolic name
   sym_name := "search_" + target_name + "_" + itoa(realtime);
   
   // Search for target
   target := findsymbolic(sym_name);
   
   if (target)
   {
     sendtext("Found target: " + target.name + "<br/>", self);
     sendtext("Safe symbolic name: " + sym_name + "<br/>", self);
   }
   else
   {
     sendtext("Target '" + target_name + "' not found.<br/>", self);
   }
 }
 dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The symbolic name system uses the format "name@zone" for global references
* Descriptive names can also be used and will be matched by the function
* The function searches the entire game world, which can be resource-intensive
* Common symbolic name formats include:
** "player_name@global" - for tracking specific players
** "unique_item_12345@global" - for unique items
** "guard@midgaard" - for city guards
* The function returns null if no matching unit is found
* Use [[Manual:DIL_Manual/findunit|findunit]] for local searches when possible instead of global searches

== Error Handling ==
The function handles errors in the following ways:
* Empty symbolic name returns null
* Null or invalid unit parameter returns null
* No runtime errors are generated for valid parameters
* The function may be resource-intensive for complex searches

Always validate that the symbolic name parameter is not empty before calling the function.
